snippet: Unions and the main employers’ lobby settled on new rules that would overhaul swaths of the rigid labor market and restore France’s international allure as a place to do business.
abstract: French labor unions and business leaders strike deal to overhaul swaths of France's notoriously rigid labor market, moving to tame confounding rules in 3,200-page labor code as country tries to increase its competitiveness and curb unemployment.
lead_paragraph: Unions and the main employers’ lobby settled on new rules that would overhaul swaths of the rigid labor market and restore France’s international allure as a place to do business.

headline.seo: Unions Back Labor Law Revisions in France
headline.main: Unions Back Revisions of Labor Law in France
headline.print_headline: Unions Back Labor Law Revisions In France
